message:
Two fantastic new HD trailers for the Japanese release:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7D0BkUe1V4Q     [Ico]
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ewACEmWP904     [SotC]
/via Joystiq
The SotC trailer made me listen to the game soundtrack again last night. Still fantastic.
I can't wait to replay these.
Yeah, they're literally up there with Uncharted 3 and Skyward Sword on my list of Great Expectations for the rest of 2011.
Also, +1 for the soundtrack.
Watching this now made me realise just now much Nier took inspiration from Ico. Wonderful, can't wait for this!
I think Ueda's work has inspired a lot of designers.  You often find traces of it where you least expect it.
I don't remember the grinding or fishing minigames in Ico, though.
Grinding? I did no such thing. The fishing mini-game was terrible though!
I always thought it was cute how Sands of Time seemed to be heavily inspired by ICO, and was then followed up later by Ubi with AC1 which (to me) seemed inspired by SotC

The intros for both games are available for viewing online. I'm not watching them, and neither should you, so I'm not posting links :P

Interestingly, ICO apparently has a new intro.

I just came here to post the link. :<

I haven't watched it myself, but that's interesting. I wonder why?
Are we there yet?
Also: I will finally be able to redeem myself for not having played ICO.
I still have no interest in ICO, SotC on the other hand....
Redeem yourself!
@ZAnimus They look predictably pretty in HD, but it's the same intro sections the two games have always had.  If you've played them before, there's no reason not to watch.
Ah, you're right. I was misinformed -- it's not the intro that's new, but rather the gameplay montage which starts up if the title screen is left idle for a bit.
Oh, hmm.  I wonder why they changed that?  Though… as I remember, that montage was low quality / heavily compressed in the original, so I guess that answers my question.
